pred_ans_conf_MCQ: Electromagnetic waves are transmitted that make up the electromagnetic spectrum
pred_ans_conf_OE: Electromagnetic waves are transmitted that make up the electromagnetic spectrum
pred_diverse_ans: The main constituent of the electromagnetic spectrum that is transmitted is electromagnetic radiation.
Electromagnetic waves are transmitted through the electromagnetic spectrum.

The transmitted elements that would constitute the electromagnetic spectrum are electromagnetic waves with different frequencies and wavelengths, including radio waves, microwaves, infrared radiation, visible light, ultraviolet radiation, X-rays, and gamma rays.
The electromagnetic spectrum is the transmission culminating into the electromagnetic spectrum.
Electromagnetic waves are transmitted by oscillating electric charges.
Yes, the transmitted element that makes up the electromagnetic spectrum is electromagnetic radiation.

Yes, the electromagnetic spectrum is a range of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation, including radio waves, microwaves, infrared radiation, visible light, ultraviolet radiation, X-rays, and gamma rays.
The electromagnetic spectrum is formed by the emission and absorption of electromagnetic radiation by matter and energy.
Electromagnetic waves are transmitted by the acceleration of electric charges.
